content:
CHRISTIAN  RELIGIOUS  KNOWLEDGE 2004  
 
 
1. What effect did the sudden death of Ananias and 
Supphira have on the early disciples? 
A. Many more disciples were won to God 
B. Great fear gripped them all 
C. The disciples became more united 
D. Apostle peter was highly respected 
 
2. Paul and Barnabas were sent out on the first missionary 
work from Antioch to Seleucia by the 
A. prophets and teachers 
B. church elders 
C. other disciples 
D. holy spirit 
 
3. ‘ “… We must work the works of him who sent me, 
while it is day; night comes, when no one can work” ’ 
Jesus made the statement above after the healing 
of the 
A. centurion’s servant B. ten lepers 
C. man born blind D. paralytic man 
 
4. ‘ “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we do 
not know where they have laid him.” ’ 
What happened immediately after Mary Magdalene 
made the statement above? 
A. Peter and the other disciple went towards the 
tomb 
B. the guards were afraid and ran away from the 
tomb 
C. Mary stood, weeping outside the tomb 
D. two angels appeared to Mary by the tomb. 
 
5. ‘ “ … For it this plan or this undertaken is of men, it 
will fail; but if it is of God, you will not be able to 
overthrow them…” ’ 
Them is Gamaliel’s statement above refers to 
A. Peter and John 
B. Peter and the apostles 
C. Paul and timothy 
D. Paul and silas 
6. Jesus declared that men love darkness rather than light 
because  
A. their hearts were hardened 
B. they had no truth 
C. they had been blinded 
D. their deeds were evil 
 
7. ‘ “ … This Jesus God raised up, and of that we all 
are witnesses…” ’ 
The statement above was made by Peter on the occasion 
of his 
A. sermon on the day of Pentecost 
B. release from prison by the Jews 
C. healing of the lame man at the gate called 
Beautiful 
D. address to the disciples for the replacement 
of Judas. 
 
8. According to John, he who does not believe in the 
only Son of God is 
A. none of his own 
B. not worthy of the Kingdom 
 
C. cast off as a branch 
D. condemned already 
 
9. ‘ “ … Are you the only visitor to Jerusalem who does 
not know the things that have happened there in these 
days?” ’ 
The things being referred to in the statement above are 
the 
A. arrest, trials and judgment of Jesus 
B. crucifixion, death and resurrection of Jesus 
C. triumphal entry and cleansing of the temple 
D. birth and presentation of Jesus. 
 
10. According to Paul, just as the law came to increase 
trespass, so sin came to increase 
A. righteousness  
B. punishment 
C. grace 
D. ungodliness.  
 
11. According to Peter, Christians who suffer 
according to the will of God will receive 
A. forgiveness 
B. the Crown of Glory 
C. the Holy Spirit 
D. blessing 
 
12. Paul declares that Christians have the same functions, 
but they have gift that differ according to 
A. their devotion of prayer 
B. their suffering and endurance 
C. grace given to the 
D. enablement by the spirit. 
 
13. According to Romans, as one man’s trespass led to 
condemnation all, so will on man’s act of righteousness 
lead to 
A. acquittal and life for all men 
B. salvation and new life for all men 
C. justification and hope for all men 
D. sanctification and life for all men 
 
14. ‘ And let steadfastness have its full effect …’ 
What does James say would be the outcome of this 
effect? 
A. Righteousness and faith. 
B. Trial and endurance 
C. Humanity and obedience 
D. Perfection and completion 
 
15. ‘Have this mind among yourselves, which is yours in 
Christ Jesus…’ 
This mind in Paul’s statement above means a mind of 
A. humanity   B.  faith C.  holiness D. prayer. 
 
16. Peter teaches that servants should be submissive to 
their masters with all respect, not only to the kind and 
gentle but also to the 
A. impatient B. inconsiderate 
C. wicked D. overbearing
